conclusion: To determine whether the two objects, A and B, have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.

Object A has a linearly increasing velocity from time \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \).
Object B has a curve that starts at \( t_1 \), reaches a peak at \( t_2 \), and then decreases.
Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Mathematically, acceleration \( a \) is given by the derivative of velocity \( v \) with respect to time \( t \): \( a = \frac{dv}{dt} \).
